Reviews.Title: “Location, location ,location”
Reviews.Author: Yarmnomad
Reviews.Content: Situated in one of the most convenient areas of Barcelona for Las Ramblas, (about 50yds away) restaurants and bars and directly opposite the famous Palau Guell, which is a must see to any visitor to this beautiful city. The hotel was basic but very clean and friendly. Our room overlooked the back of the hotel which was colourful with views of locals balconies. I will definitely stay here again and recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel,fab location”
Reviews.Author: Kirsty38
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group of girlfriends in march,we had a twin room each with a balcony.The balcony was big and we had a view over the back of the hotel.The bathroom was very big and we had a bath! the beds were firm but comfy.It was very clean.Staff were friendly and the location was perfect just steps off Las ramblas directly opposite Parc Guell (i would ask for a room over the other side of the hotel next time) Really good location good base to explore Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & price!”
Reviews.Author: zippiSuperior
Reviews.Content: Hotel Gaudi is located just steps off of Las Ramblas and directly faces Palau Guell. We stayed twice, pre and post cruise. Precruise we were on the 4th floor and post cruise on the 5th. Rooms on both levels were good, with great views of the Palau Guell fairy chimneys on the rooftoop, although if I were to choose one level it would be the 5th with a corner room. The corner rooms seemed a bit more roomier. Breakfast was excellent and our last day we had to be to the airport prior to the breakfast room opening and were provided a breakfast to go. I thought that was very thoughtful of the hotel to do! I had read previous posts about the rooms facing the street being noisy, but we did not find that to be a problem at all. However, we were there mid January, which is lower season. We had drinks at the hotel bar one evening and the bartender was very accommodating, we did not try the restaurant though. I would definitely stay at the Hotel Gaudi again. Easy walking distance to the Picasso museum, hop on/off bus stop, and other sites.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: Katy G
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Hotel Gaudi and was quite worried due to some TA reviews, fortnuately the hotel was excellent. The beds were very firm and i slept like a log, we were in room 116 which was at the back of the hotel and was very quite getting the sun until about 7 in the evening. the breakfast was good too, typical continental with restaurant over looking the Palau Guell. One hint is to go to the top of the hotel in the lift (floor 6) and go out onto the balcony where you can have fantastic views of the city down to the harbour and up to the mountain. All in all excellent little hotel literally steps off 'La Rambla' offering incredible value for money.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING CITY-POOR HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: ROBIN D
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to be going to Barcelona for the first time. So many of my friends had travelled to this world famous destination, and practically everyone returned with happy, fun tales of the city. Although, I loved every minute of my week in the Catalan capital, the Hotel Gaudi was a very big disappointment. As a solo traveller, I had to put up with a small, dark, cramped, very noisy, and reeking of cigarette smoke, internal room. I have know Idea why, it can advertise itself as a three star hotel. The only positive thing I can say about the place is that the location, which is just off Las Ramblas, is perfect for getting to all the tourist attractions, the beach, and anything else you which to discover. The city is so beautiful, and I would love to return, but will stay anywhere but this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pilgrim51
Reviews.Content: Ok - perhaps five stars is half a star too much but this hotel has a great location and is very good value for money. The hotel is situated in a little street just off las Ramblas and easy walking distance from Placa de Catalunya.We got the aerobus from Barcelona airport to Placa de Catalunya 5.20€ each and walked down Las Ramblas- good fun in itself- enjoy the living statues! I had prebooked this hotel 7 months in advance as a surprise 60th birthday present for my husband. After trawling through many reviews for hotels in the area - I was totally hooked on the idea of this hotel with a view over the amazing Palau Guell. I emailed the hotel and told them about my plan and Monica was exceptionally helpful - not only did we have a room with a view of Palau Guell but we were on floor 5 with a balcony with two chairs, sun lounger and table. The hotel even greeted us with a bottle of fizz to celebrate my husband's birthday. The room - although not huge- was absolutely fine , very clean- with french windows out onto the balcony - there were also slatted shutters which kept the room cool and secure. We had no problem with any noice from the street but I assume that is because we were on floor five and the balcony pushes the room back from the road. The breakfast was fine - the usual selection of pastries, fruit, cheese, meat, scrambled eggs, 3 different cereals, yoghurts, bread rolls, bread for toast, a juice machine with two different juices, hot drinks machine etc- but of course you may still want to venture out onto Las Ramblas. My only issue is the lack of tea/coffee macking facilities and the lack of a fridge- which must be annoying in the height of summer. However the hotel has a small cafe where you can get snacks and drinks until quite late - there is also a vending machine for water and drinks on the restaurant floor. But anyway Barcelona is a city which carries on until very late - we had no problem getting a meal at nearly 11pm. The hotel is in an excellent location for exploring the Barri Gotic,Port Vell, the Cathedral and it was easy to pick up both of the tourist buses. Loads of nice little restaurants/ bars/ shops etc nearby. Enjoy an evening wathcing the world go by in Placa Reial- just the other side of Las Ramblas Palau Guell is well worth a visit- but the view over the ornate chimneys is wonderful. This is a great hotel for the price, very clean and in a great location. We found the staff very friendly and helpful - Monica especially brilliant- she always replied to my emails. We had an early evening flight back to the Uk but were able to leave our cases in a secure space at the hotel and also used the hotel public areas until we returned to the airport. I have no hesitation in recommending Hotel Gaudi- great venue in a great city

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in the heart of the City!”
Reviews.Author: Kayem26
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located just off the Las Ramblas, opposit the Placa Reial. Across from Palau Guell. Close to most attractions within the city. The hotel is simple in decoration but very confotable and the rooms are well maintained, comfortable and clean. The hotel staff are polite and helpful and speak good english. This hotel is excellent value for money, we booked a room with a balcony which had a good view of the city. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in Barcelona and great value for money! A good find!

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and local atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Hengold
Reviews.Content: An ideal location just steps from La Rambla, Barcelona's "main drag" and across the street from the Palau Guell, a major visitor attraction makes the Hotel Gaudi a good pick. Furnishings are simple, but clean. The breakfast buffet is excellent. Overall, this is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: jasicle
Reviews.Content: Nice clean and well presented Hotel. Just off the Ramblas so very very well placed. Staff were helpful and pleasant and the room was decent sized with good over the bath shower. Our room was 129 on the first floor and the only draw back was that it overlooked the local police station which in the early hours was a tad noisey if you had the window open. The breakfast was varied and well prepared. Would use this again with out hesitaion.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: fincati
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in Gaudi hotel. Hotel was ok in every way. The room was clean but quite small. Breakfast was included in room brice and was ok. Location was good, however the noice from the street made sleeping impossible. If you are not planning on sleeping then this hotel offers good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hotel Gaudi”
Reviews.Author: annadoglover
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended hotel. I would stay here again for sure. Excellent location and not noisy.Fantastic twin room with own balcony and fine views of Gaudis chimney pots! (room 422) Paid extra for the view and balcony and well worth it. A real sun trap even in February! P.s watch out for pick pocket thieves on the metro..they nearly ruined a great holiday for me!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: milchtoast
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent five nights here. We booked because of the location and the good price offered by the hotel's website for our late-January stay. We were initially given a standard double room with a small balcony looking across to Palau Guell. We had two main problems with this room -- firstly, though deemed "non-smoking" it reeked of smoke, and secondly, we found the noise in the street below to be very irritating when trying to sleep (people were yelling and smashing bottles at 3am, and the noise really bounces around the narrow street). When we complained about these things, the staff was very kind and accommodating and switched us to a room with two twin beds pushed together and a balcony off the back of the hotel. Funnily, this room had a sign saying "smoking permitted," as well as an ashtray, but it didn't smell of smoke at all. It was very quiet at night, which made us happy -- we'd rather have quiet than a fancy view. Breakfast was included in our stay, and while it was plentiful, we didn't enjoy it so much: as others have pointed out, the coffee, juice, bread, etc. are not of great quality. We did not try the hot foods on offer (eggs and such), but my husband liked the pastries. There are a few things that bothered me and would make me not return: towels that smelled very strongly of bleach, beds that are extremely firm (though some may enjoy this), pillows that are uncomfortably high, bathrooms that ventilate steam not with fans but with a little window opening onto a strange, dark shaft. Overall, the things that recommend this hotel are its kind staff and its good location. I would not recommend staying here if you have aversions to street noise or the smell of smoke, though our problems with both of these were luckily resolved.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location and the Terrace”
Reviews.Author: PaleGale
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Gaudi for two nights prior to the departure of our cruise. The location is excellent and within a short walking distance to Las Ramblas and the waterfront. We found the staff excellent and very helpful. Our room was average but was rendered excellent when we opened the curtains and discovered a fabulous terrace that overlooked the Palau Guell. We spent two evenings sipping wine on the terrace and looking at the wonderful work of Gaudi. Overall the room was clean, comfortable and had everything we needed. We certainly would stay here again. We cannot comment on the breakfast served as it was not included in our room rate and we opted to walk to Las Ramblas to eat breakfast everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Curates egg”
Reviews.Author: John G
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Barcelona after a four day pre Christmas break &, have got to say that we would not return to the Gaudi - good spot (though shut your window if you have a museum view), friendly enough staff, clean rooms (though small & basic - you should have a fridge / minibar in this day & age), average breakfast, no more than that, BUT! as someone else has commented earlier it has ridiculously thin walls, on our last night a couple who had just taken over the next room which had been empty talked (nothing more!) all night long - their conversation was plain to here & it made for a fitful nights sleep. You should get the basics right & the Gaudi doesn't in this respect. This review is not a case of sour grapes but there are plenty of other 3 starish Barca hotels that we've stayed in & would return to but, unfortunately not this one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: alltrazero
Reviews.Content: Hotel Guadi has an excellent location and a great breakfast buffet. Decor is modern with nice art nouveau touches in the public spaces. Beds are a bit stiff. I recommend a room with a spacious balcony and beautiful views of Gaudi's Palau Guel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is not customer oriented”
Reviews.Author: lm23Ohio
Reviews.Content: I have been trying to contact this hotel for weeks now, with no response. I have sent emails, comments on booking reservation, 2 phone calls that a lady tells me to call another time for reservations, and a fax. If anyone has helpful information how to contact them, I could use it, as I am trying to book 5 rooms for July for 13 people, and they don't seem to care or need the business.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Rafa123654
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Hotel Gaudi a few times and have recently returned from a weekend stay there. The hotel is in an excellent location - just off the Ramblas but without the noise. The rooms are fairly basic (no kettle or fridge) but with so many cafes and restaurants within a stones throw do you actually need these? We've never stayed in one of the rooms with the large balconies (looking over Palau Guell) but family members have and they are fantastic. The breakfasts are typical Spanish (so don't expect a full English or wide choice of cereals) and we now usually just have room only and have something at a cafe. We've always found the staff very helpful and of the three hotels we've stay at in Barcelona this is the one we keep returning to.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday surprise”
Reviews.Author: Jenny61_11
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short break in Barcelona with my husband and our daughter and son.I had no idea where we were staying as it had been sorted as a surprise for my 50th birthday by my family.The hotel was in an excellent position in a side street just off La Rambla and in an ideal position for getting around to other attractions especially if you used the tour buses (well worth doing ).The rooms were very comfortable our room was on the third floor with a small balcony which overlooked the Palau Guell with its impressive roof ( although at night there was a lot of street noise which stopped you getting a decent nights sleep ),our son and daughter had rooms on different floors but not overlooking the street so therefore much quieter which i would do if we returned.Breakfast was buffet style with a reasonable choice and on my birthday the hotel surprised me with a bottle of Bubbly to celebrate ( went down very well even at breakfast !!!).The management and staff were all very friendly and helpful.On the evening of my birthday we went to a lovely restaurant on La Rambla called The Attic which i would definitely recommend. On the whole everything about this break was very good and would certainly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Magical surrounding”
Reviews.Author: mimmica
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 3 yrs ago. A really nice surprise was waiting for us when we got there.. We booked a double room and got one on the last floor (if you don't count suits) with a large terrace, 2 chairs and a table, it was wonderful! This was coz we were staying for 10 nights, so we got a nice room. Relaxing after a long day of exploring all wonders of this magical city with a glass of white vine on the roof was really nice! Great location, just seconds from La Rambla but yet quit and peaceful. Room was clean, comfortable, modern, staff friendly and helpful. They even agreed to keep our goat cheese from Monserat in the fridge by tdeparture time. But, if you are planning to rent a car, do some research before you go, coz we ended up with the overpriced agency recommended by the clerk at the reception. Reason I am giving it 4* is breakfast which was ok, but completely the same every single day, so if this is important thing for your stay, you may wanna try other options. I didn't have that big problem, but some vegetables would have been nice!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: craftyketley
Reviews.Content: Went with my husband and adult daughter and booked the junior suite which was ideal. Large living area with two couches and separate bedroom with sliding door in between and although our daughter had to come through the bedroom to reach the bathroom it wasn`t really a problem.Large terrace with fantastic view over Barcelona. It was also good to have free wi fi which worked efficiently. Nitpicking a bit, I do wish hotel owners would actually sleep in their rooms in order to eliminate small annoyances. The mirror in the living area was too high when seated on the chair in front of it to see into it. There was no hook in bathroom to hang bath robes and no shelf or soap dish in shower to put gels, shampoos etc when showering! However we had a great stay and it was so quiet and very central.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, view and nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Vivafood
Reviews.Content: If going to Barcelona for Gaudi then this is the place. See pics for the view from the patio in room #520. Hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. Hotel was clean and tidy with flat screen tv's and large bathrooms. Perfect location right across from the Gaudi/Guell home/museum and off of the main touristy action packed street of Las Ramblas. Few blocks to the wonderful Boqueria market. Market is closed on Sundays and the Gaudi/Guell home closed on Mondays . Would for sure stay again. Big "Hola" to Carmen in the cafe/bar. Happy travels.

Reviews.Title: “Great view great location”
Reviews.Author: Scarletlasceo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights after our Mediterranean cruise. The hotel met every expectation. The room was clean and the terrace looking at the Gaudi palace was perfect. Quiet location right off the center of La Rambla. Buy your hop on hop off bus discounts at the front desk of the hotel. You save 4 euros each. Large included breakfast was a nice touch - included eggs, sausage and potatoes. They went the extra mile for us on the morning we left because breakfast was not being served yet, so they made us a picnic breakfast for us to take with us. We would definitely return and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation and location!”
Reviews.Author: mrandmrsmorris
Reviews.Content: I recently enjoyed 2 nights at the excellent Hotel Gaudi. The hotel is located in a small side street yards from the famous La Rambla. The location couldn't be better, only a 10 minute walk to Rambla del Mar and a further 5 minutes to Port Vell. The gothic quarter is also an easy stroll from the hotel. Its also only an easy 15 minutes down La Rambla from Placa Catalunya where the airport express bus service drops you off. The hotel is typical Spanish style decor with a Gaudiesque water fountain in the lobby. The rooms and all the public areas were spotlessly clean if a little jaded in places. The hotal staff were all very friendly and the breakfast was more than adequate. There was all the usual cereal, yoghurts, breads, pastries, cheese, ham and fresh fruit on offer, plus a small hot section of bacon sausages and eggs. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel for a stay in the fabulous city of Barcelona. My only word of warning is not about the hotel but the pickpockets, all the zips on my backpack were opened one afternoon while strolling around the gothic quarter. Nothing was taken because there was nothing of value in my bag but I was amazed that someone could have unzipped my bag and had a rummage without me being aware of it! Don't let it put you off visiting this fabulous city but take extra care with your bags and valubales. Finally, on a happy note, enjoy a beer, glass of wine or cocktail at a bar on the Placa Reial immediately across La Rambla from the hotel and watch the square light up and come alive as darkness descends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic find with only a few minor points”
Reviews.Author: Julie A
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in October and had a great time. The location is ideal for a short stay in Barcelona as it is just off Las Ramblas. The reception staff were fantastic, very helpful (especially Jesus). After our first night we asked to move room as we appeared to be beneath an engine room of some sort (520) that kept us awake most of the night. We were then moved to room 421 which was fantastic (bigger than 520 - more room to move about and more wardrobe space). Like others have stated, the views from the superior rooms from the 4th floor upwards are fantastic! Just remember that tourists can see in your room if the balcony doors are open! Rooms are also not very sound proof. The breakfast was good considering it was continental. Cereals, toast, fruit, meats, cheese, bread rolls, scrambled and boiled egg, sausage, bacon, pastries, tea, coffee an fruit juice. We found some good bars and restaurants heading down Las Ramblas towards the sea taking the last street on the left. Make sure you know the price of your tapas before you order it as we got ripped off with gambas pil pil (prawns in oil and garlic) at one restaurant where we were charged 17 euros for it! The airport bus runs from the top of Las Ramblas and is just over 5 euro per person to El Prat airport. We flew in to Girona and the bus was approx 12 euro from there to Barcelona. Best Metro stop for Nou Camp is Maria Cristina on the green line. We would stay here again if we were guaranteed room 421.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag but overall very good”
Reviews.Author: jane190734
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights following a stay down at the beach/port olimpic. We had upgraded before travelling to the top floor and were certainly glad we had as the views from the very large private sun terrace over Barcelona were superb. The room itself was good but the large terrace made the difference. The rooms were cleaned immaculately every day and the reception staff were vry friendly and helpful. However, the breakfast we felt was not the best, what there was to eat was perfectly edible but there was not much choice. Also, the hotel was very noise very early in the morning from the constant lift noise and we think perhaps the boiler. Would stay again but only if we were guaranteed room 615. (There are two rooms on the very top floor and 614, the other also has a large sun terrace but not as good an overall view as 615).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, Excellent location, Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nir L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Gaudi Hotel from Oct. 13th till Oct. 17th 2011 (2 adults + 2 childrens in one room for four). We have ordered Gaudi Hotel in the Internet after getting the good advises from TripAdvisor. The reservation was very good and easy and we got confirmation by e-mail in minutes. We arrived 2 hours before check-in time and the room was ready for us. The stuff treated us very well and where very nice. The breakfast was good and satisfying. The rooms was very good, causy and clean. The hotel location is more then ecellent, 50 meter from the middle of La Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Lynne H
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Gaudi for 3 nights from recommendations on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. The hotel is so well located, just off La Rambla and very convenient to the metro. We arrived before check-in time, but were able to leave our bags locked away securely while we did some sightseeing. All the staff throughout our stay were very helpful and courteous. We had Room 518, a double superior, with a great balcony which overlooked the funky Gaudi chimneys at Palau Güell across the street. (Be sure to visit, it is one of Gaudi's early works and very interesting). The room was spacious and had plenty of hanging space and cupboards, bed was comfortable and bathroom very clean. The free wi-fi worked well in our room. The only negative was that our air conditioner was quite noisy. Breakfast was good with the usual European foods, plus scrambled egg and bacon. We would definitely recommend this 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “just off the main street but a quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: salanddave315
Reviews.Content: this is just off the street of Rambles which seems to be the main tourist area of Barcalona, it was in a quiet street and it was a quiet hotel. staff were friendly the rooms were basic, but clean and comfortable and ours had a small balony there were 4 of us in a room, after reading another reviewers comment about not getting enough beds for 4 people, we emailed ahead and got confirmation, there were 2 single beds and 2 beds that unfolded from the wall breakfast was ok, a good variety there is free wifi (which I couldnt get to work) and 2 free computers to use. also a gym but I didnt look at it its a very short walk to cafes and bars, the metro etc after visiting other cities in southern Spain, I found Barcalona very expensive

Reviews.Title: “Superb location; wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrGilbus
Reviews.Content: Paid a bit extra for superior room - well worth it. Our own sun-terrace looking straight across the street to the roof-top of Palau de Guell with its amazing Gaudi chimneys - see photo. Unbeatable location; literally a few yards and we were on Las Ramblas. Breakfasts were good. night cap in the bar was good value. Room very comfortable. Definitely recommend this excellent value hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location - a stumble to La Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: SteveS14
Reviews.Content: This is a quality hotel with well appointed and large sized rooms and full balconies. It's strongest feature is the location which is opposite the fantastic Palau Guell, a Gaudi building of surreal pleasures that can be enjoyed just fine from your hotel balcony which looks to it. Reception staff gave great service and were helpful in locating a lost bag and cab. All the while La Ramblas beckons just 100 feet away. Breakfast the next day was fine as well, plenty to cure the Rioja led evening the night before!

Reviews.Title: “Gobsmacked!”
Reviews.Author: TLCMysore
Reviews.Content: Went to Spain for my sons wedding in Aiansa. Stayed in Barcelona on Thursday 22nd September in an apartment. Vowed I would never do the same again, dreadful (more later), so when wife and i returned to Barcelona on Monday 26th September I looked for an hotel and purely by chance found the Hotel Gaudi. Close to La Rambla and unbelievable. Staff friendly and helpful, cost not exorbitant when you think it's in the heart of Barcelona and rooms fantastic! On the 6th floor with its own terrace with a magnificent view over Barcelona. Clean, huge double bed, Shower, bath, room service, parking, great included breakfast, wow, I could go on and on! We only stayed one night, as we were in transit, but could have spent a lot of time there; great!

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: ashton905
Reviews.Content: I and 5 friends stayed in July for 2 days and wished we had more time to spend. Hotel was in a very good location. Just around the corner from Las Ramblas. Accomodations were comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Bel04
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled to get a room with a balcony facing the wonderful Palau Guell, as some others have said, the noise could be a problem at the front, but it's a city centre hotel so what else can you expect? We were never disturbed by any noise though especially when the air con is on. Really easy to find, just follow the signs for Palau Guell. Great reception staff, good breakfast, amazing location, very clean, I'd definitely return and recommend Hotel Gaudi to my friends.....

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichelleCook
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights. I got a room on the front of the hotel so there was plenty of light. There was some street noise but was not bad when I had the air conditioning on. The front desk had one concierge who directed me to a couple of really good, non tourist, restaurants. The woman concierge was extremely rude to me for no apparent reason. The main problem is that is located close to the Ramblas, which was crowded and full of tourists. At night there were a lot of young people getting drunk until very late hours I will probably not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MsMaria0000
Reviews.Content: My two friends and I stayed in the Hotel Gaudi, in a room with a balcony facing the wonderful Palau Guell, another Gaudi creation. A mansion designed and built by Gaudi, he created a home that was a work of art, out down to the magnificent chimneys that we looked at from our balconly while we sipped the local wine and listened to the chatter/banter/noises of the street below. A few metres to the Las Ramblas, and we were in the heart of it, travel down any lane and you are in a city so fascinating and magical that a few days was just not enough. The hotel room was clean and comfortable. Bathroom, toilet and shower worked very well, the only thing I can think of in the negative sense, was that the lift is small when carrying up suitcases, but then you just take it in turns to take your luggage up. There are so many great places to eat once you get off the main drag (the Ramblas) . If you stay on the Ramblas the food and drink is over priced and expensive. I dream of going back there.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Management”
Reviews.Author: charismaticxoxo
Reviews.Content: Barcelona was the last stop for our vacation and Hotel Gaudi was the worst hotel we stayed in during our trip due to management. When we arrived, they told us there would be ONE double bed for the 4 of us. The room itself stated double bed room (assuming there are 2 double beds). When I had booked the room, I had indicated 4 adults. I even emailed the hotel after booking to confirm all was ok. They wanted to charge us for an additional person even though the booking CLEARLY stated 4 adults. The front desk was rude about it and not accomdating whatsoever. They kept on bringing up the fact the room was for 2 adults + breakfast. How is it our fault that you confirmed the room for 4 after the fact? Finally, we told them breakfast was unnecessary (seriously? we were in Barcelona - I can very much do without hotel breakfast) and they added an additional bed to the room. This was definitely not the way we wanted to start off in Barcelona. Location - it was good. Right in the Las Ramblas. No complaints there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, would recommend to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: joooooles
Reviews.Content: We were backpacking through Europe so any where that didn't have communal bathrooms was a plus, but this hotel was by far our favourite. Beautiful big rooms, comfy beds, massive bathroom and a cute little balcony for a standout price! You're walking distance to some great Tapas and not too far from the harbour. A big high 5 from us, we were sad to check out.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel and will be back”
Reviews.Author: pedjat
Reviews.Content: Great position and a very decent hotel,the staff were very informative.Especially the reception.The rooms are clean and the bathrooms were clean I could not think of a better place to stay for a short trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: BonJoviGroupie
Reviews.Content: This is a fun place to stay in Barcelona. We stayed in the junior suite which was very nice. However, the views on the other side of the hotel are much better. I would book two rooms on the other side if I were going to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay at the Gaudi”
Reviews.Author: Gaggyboot
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights. The hotel location is great and the staff supberb. The booking was faultless and from arrival to leaving our stay was great. The bedrooms are large with great beds and the maids are very helpful. fresh bed linen each day. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Not what i expected, but ok.”
Reviews.Author: mandy62
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three nights in their Junior Suite. I booked the room directly and spoke to a woman named Monica. She assured me that i have a room with a view of Gaudi structures. She said this is the best room in the hotel and i paid a premium money for that. When we arrived, i was surprised to see that the room was in fact in the back with a view of neighborhood laundry line. I immediately went downstairs and was informed by the receptionist that there is only one Junior Suite and that is the one i got and that i was obviously misinformed! He offered to downgrade me to a family room (for the same price). We decided to stay in the Junior Suite and let go of the view. Having said that, the suite was spacious, the bathroom was large enough for my family, and the tv worked! However, we never used the terrace, because of the horrible views... The breakfast was very good, the location was excellent and it allowed us to be back and forth several times a day, which was good for my family. I had the best doner kabab from the sandwich place across from the hotel. The parking was expensive and really tight, but i figured that is a norm in Barcelona. The location allows you to basically walk any where. We did the sightseeing tour the first day and then explored by foot and bikes. We walked to many places, even to Sargada (that one i did by myself!). We walked to the Pier and rented bikes and explored the beach area. We walked to the acquariium and the whole pier. And, the location allowed us to split and reunite for various sightseeing. Overall, if i go back i will definitely stay near La Ramble, but perhaps a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and staff”
Reviews.Author: kmartinez
Reviews.Content: I primarily booked this hotel based on trip advisor reviews and location. The Palau Guell and the nearby Las Ramblas are excellent landmarks for finding your way around in Barcelona, especially if your trip is short and sweet like ours was. Barcelona itself is easier to navigate by foot than it might seem. Check in was lovely--we were celebrating an anniversary and the staff brought up a beautiful complimentary bottle of cava and took a photo--how sweet! Definitely ask for a room facing the Palau on a higher floor--it is trippy to go out onto a balcony and be so close. Very big room, clean, and wonderfully comfy bed. Didn't have breakfast, so can't comment. The only improvement I could foresee is better room service menu options, but you know, if you're in Barcelona, you should probably be forcing yourself to go out and eat (which we did)!

Reviews.Title: “Great view from room 615”
Reviews.Author: Maggie028
Reviews.Content: Very friendly, helpful staff. Comfortable room, good breakfast. Room 615 has a terrace almost as large as the room, with views over the city and the sea. I'd definitely stay there again. M from London

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Top Location”
Reviews.Author: Jakearch
Reviews.Content: Could not fault this hotel during our stay. All staff that we had contact with were friendly and helpful. We had a family room (2 Adults & 2 teens) for a 4 night break. Room was a good size with 4 single beds that an adult could actually sleep on i.e. no pull-outs. The buffet breakfast was ideal to set you up for the day. The location on a side street off the bottom of Las Ramblas was ideal for access to the old town, port & metro. The room did not have a fridge but there are numerous local late night shops next to the hotel for last minute water, beers, snacks etc.

Reviews.Title: “FOR GAUDI FANATICS”
Reviews.Author: bundi9
Reviews.Content: Situated right opposite the Palau Guell, one of Gaudi's masterpieces. Also perfect for Las Ramblas. Very reasonably priced, considering its location. Room and breakfast OK. Enormous bathroom. Very helpful front desk. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: Ilovewham
Reviews.Content: Fantastic service, extremely friendly and helpful reception, let me have my room early, remembered my name-the little things that count for a lot!!! Its just off Las Ramblas so fantastic location in between two metro stations Liceu and Drassanes (but in El Raval so for wary types maybe only turn left on leaving the hotel, personally i like El Raval!!) Our room for the price was very small and had no view at all, very disappointing (i wish i could remember the room number!), it was clean and the bed was fairly comfortable but i think that it was extremely overpriced. Unless you are guaranteed a view i would definately go somewhere else. The common areas were very nice, the homage to gaudi! I didn't have breakfast so I can't comment on that!

Reviews.Title: “Good location just off the Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: Nz_shez
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the centre of Barcelona then this hotel is in a fantastic location, just off the Ramblas. We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in May 2011 and it was good. Our room was clean and the bathroom very spacious. We were able to walk most places from this hotel that we wanted to go. Overall this is a good hotel for the price in central Barcelona. There is no free wifi but there is a public computer with internet that you can use for free. We had a car and found the parking to be very expensive (the parking garage is next door to the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “spacious room, well located”
Reviews.Author: siewyok
Reviews.Content: we were a family of 3, had a spacious room with spacious bathroom, on top floor with a large terrace which was a big plus, given that many hotels in barcelona are very small. decor is simple but tasteful and functional. downside is room is noisy, (we were there for one night). we would have shut the terrace doors and windows since they seem to be double glazed, but could not do so cos the aircon in the room was noisy and dirty (we had to wash the aircon filter which looked like it needed a good wash). rest of the room was clean tho. the man at the reception was not friendly altho the bell hops were efficient and helpful. free wifi was a plus point as was the competent breakfast, which is free if you book from the hotel website.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: rjc_56
Reviews.Content: For a 3 star hotel, Hotel Gaudi was fantastic. It's located only 50m from La Rambla and an easy walk from the airport bus terminal. The room was a good size and exceptionally clean and the free WIFI was accessible throughout the hotel. The staff could not have been more friendly or helpful, whether it was providing directions for sightseeing or arranging a picnic breakfast on our day of departure as we were leaving early in the morning. The buffet breakfast was also excellent with cooked options as well as the usual food. However, the real highlight was the view from our balcony over Palau Güell. We had room 423 and it had a massive balcony overlooking the roof of Palau Güell and its colourful chimneys. It was great to sit on the balcony sipping a glass of red wine in the evening and look over at the people wandering around the Palau Güell rooftop. I would strongly recommend that you ask for a room on the upper floors with this wonderful view. Will definitely come back to the Hotel Gaudi if we visit Barcelona again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kittylou_11
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a 3 night stay at this hotel and cannot fault it. The location, just off La Rambla is excellent, the hotel is spotless and the staff friendly and helpful. We had 2 rooms on the 5th floor, overlooking the Palau Guell, with huge terraces and did not pay a King's Ransom for the priveledge. This is an unpretentious 3 star hotel. The breakfast is self service and, whilst not extensive, plentiful. Not sure what the rooms on the lower floors are like but rooms at the front on floors 4 and 5 have good terraces and good views from the 5th floor. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel made our trip special we weill ruturn.”
Reviews.Author: gungadin_11
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a marvellous part of the City. The room was very good ,breakfast was very much above average.I advise travellars to purchase the bus passes to see the City before roaming on foot to select the areas they wish to see more closely.Barcelona is truly a BEAUTIFUL City and well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel off La Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: sandeep70
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel alongwith two other families. Its a good hotel at a convinient location, just off La Rambla. I normally pay by cash and had to make the payment in advance on arrival though the reservation was confirmed on a credit card. This was the first time when i have paid the hotel charges at the time of check-in. There was no free internet and we had to pay 2.5 euros a day for the safe , which was again a first to me. The person at the reception was not very friendly and the lady at the reception in the evening could not provide us the required tourist information. i found the hotel expensive, though the rooms were nice. The airport busstop is around 15 minutes walking distance from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: glawsboy1 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly situated to explore Barcelona. The staff were very helpful and the rooms spotless. Don'y drink in the bar however it is expensive and there are many better places to relax nearbye. We highly recommend this hotel and city for a short break

Reviews.Title: “GREAT TIME SPENT IN BARCELONA AND HOTEL GAUDÍ”
Reviews.Author: JIRKAMAT
Reviews.Content: I would like to share my appreciation of the Gaudí hotel service during our stay 6.-10.5.2011. Thanks to the staff friendliness and care, we spent in the beautiful city of Barcelona one of our most remarkable and memorable stays ever. The location was absolutely perfect and so was the service – also the fact that the hotel offered a bottle of sparkling wine on our arrival as a birthday present to our son was really stunning and we enjoyed it „heavenly“ on the terrace of the room 419, watching the spectacular Palau Guell just accross the street, almost a hand-reach away. It has been a pure enjoyment and we will be happy to come back soon again. JIRI MATOUSEK

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: rosie098
Reviews.Content: i ahve just come back from this hotel hotel, it was excellent, close to every thing you need, all within walking distance or the metro station, sleep was a little harder to get on the friday night but not to bad. The hotel spotless, the staff friendly, very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “no bell staff. 2 elevators; you are on your own.many shops right next door.”
Reviews.Author: codecarole
Reviews.Content: we wanted a 3 star hotel near the ramblas with a gaudi view we got that, .i have a handicap scooter so of course i cant manage the luggage, neither of us could.their watress brought up the luggage but no-one to take it down at 6:00am to catch planes.they packed a picnic breakfast as our planes were before the included breakfast. we had a heater but no one to show us how to use it and it was cold.the bagthroom was completely appointed,bidet and all. if our tour guide did not run up the 4 flights of stairs and unstuck my scooter and take down the luggage, i dont know what we would have done,so thanks to Barcelona day tours and Carlos for saving the day

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Riad S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. The location is perfect, just off the Ramblas, and we weren't disturbed at all by any outside noise, even on Friday and Saturday night. Rooms are spacious and clean, the buffet breakfast (included in the room price) was plentiful and with a good choice. The hotel has wifi, which we could access anywhere in the hotel, and there is also a computer available to guests at Reception, with free Internet access. The front desk staff all spoke English and were very helpful. The only negative comment I have is that I didn't think it was worth paying the extra for a superior room with views of Palau Guell. I would definitely go back, but I would just take a standard room. And I would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Vera87
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel for a week this March, and the place is lovely! First of all, it is located in the very center; it is a bit off La Rambla, but not too far (2 minutes walking), so at night it is rather quiet but at the same time not scary to walk around, because the sidestreet is still full of shops and people. The hall is very nice and has elegancy; not many people, a computer with free internet access, and the staff is friendly enough most of the times. My room was not very big, there was basically just a bed and no more space, but the bathroom was much bigger than i expected, and everything was very, very clean and with no smells. The breakfast is not very fancy, but basically there was all i needed - 2-3 types of meats, some cheese, eggs with bacon, toast, and some more stuff. Not a gourmet restaurant, but just what you need to get full before a long day. The sleep quality for me was perfect, because my window faced the inner yard. But i must say that the walls are thin, and you hear a lot of what your neighbours are doing. Mine were very quiet, and the hotel was actually half empty, but i guess in high seasons the noise might just be a bit of a problem. All in all, the hotel is charming and absolutely worth the money. I will be definitely recommending it around.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: amyduffin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a great location, perfect for sightseeing, and most places are able to be reached by foot. Close enough to La Rambla to feel as though you are part of the hustle and bustle, but just far enough away to be able to sleep peacefully, the hotel was perfect and met our expectations. Staff were friendly, breakfast was perfect and plentiful. Only problem was no WI-FI.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with awesome view”
Reviews.Author: dhr78
Reviews.Content: Gaudi Hotel is a good hotel, located on the city area. The Room, the service is great and clean. We had the room viewing to the Gaudi building. The staff is very helpfull. I just find it, it's very good. The hotel located on the city centre, if you travelling from the Airport we advice you not to take Taksi, as it will be expensive. From Airport take Bus A1 to the city centre at plaza de catalunya, then walk down to The Rambla (beware of pick pockets, theft and other bad things, keep your belongings, don't let other people try to help you clean your dirt *they will make u'r clothes dirty and try to help clean it for you, while their friends steal your things*) walk all the way to La Rambla approx 10-15 minutes. then, you will find signage of gaudi works on the right side, there you go...

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location~uncomfortable bed~room view not great~no water fountain or ice machine~some pluses”
Reviews.Author: HanaPrincess
Reviews.Content: Very convenient 1/2 block away from La Rambla. Service was okay. Front desk did not make change for large bills. No ice machine or water fountain. Breakfast was okay with eggs, meats, pastries, cereal, coffee, orange juice and pineapple juice was a plus. Orange marmalade jam very bitter, but maybe that is the way they eat sweets in Spain. Free computer usage for internet a plus. Rooms were clean, but beds were hard and uncomfortable. View was of apartment buildings with laundry drying on balcony was very cultural. See photos attached. Room had a safe for a user fee. Exercise equipment did not work. More english speaking television channels would have been nice as there were only two. Will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay--Hotel Gaudi”
Reviews.Author: designguy69
Reviews.Content: Loved the Hotel Gaudi. It is a very clean establishment. We had a room in the back of the hotel. It has a balcony and is quieter than the street side. At night the street can be loud and crazy. The room was comfortable and adequate. The beds were comfortable but not plush. They were very low, old, firm and bouncy. I did sleep well, though. An all day travel helped with that. The room is very clean. The air conditioner didn't work so we opened the balcony door. There was a cool enough breeze. The hotel stay included breakfast. They had croissants, cereal, breads, sausage, ham/bacon, juices, scrambled eggs, yogurt, fruits and a few other things. It was very nice. If you travel with lots of luggage be prepared to take several trips up the elevator. It is about the size of a phone booth. I'm sure it was retro-fitted into this old hotel. The hotel is about 1/2 block from La Rambla. La Rambla is one of the most popular hang-outs and has many off chute streets where you can shop, wonder, eat and enjoy. Watch-out for the pick pockets! They're everywhere. Read up on the subject online and prepare yourself. Barcelona is supposedly the pick pocket capital of Europe. As for the hotel I felt very safe, though. It's also tastefully decorated with various Gaudi motifs. Enjoy! I did!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: girl_from_vancity
Reviews.Content: My mother and I spent three fantastic days in Barcelona in mid-October 2010 and were very satisfied with our accommodations at the Hotel Gaudi. I chose it based on the positive reviews I had read on TripAdvisor, and was not disappointed. We stayed in a lovely room on the 5th floor, with a huge terrace overlooking the fantastical spires of the Palau Guell. The room was a decent size for a European hotel, with a large, pristinely kept bathroom, good shower, and clean, comfortable beds. The terrace was a wonderful amenity, and the locking shutters and windows made us feel very safe and secure. We also really enjoyed the breakfasts, which offered a lot of choice and were served in a lovely room. The hotel also has a nice reading room and a shared computer with 24-hour internet access. We were so busy enjoying Barcelona that we didn't take time to explore the fitness facilities. The location is perfect - just off Las Ramblas, on the much quieter Nou de la Rambla. We were not bothered by any kind of street noise, but were within steps of the busy main tourist area, a few blocks from the metro station where we caught a train to the Sagrada Familia and the funicular to Montjuic, and about a fifteen minute stroll from the Barri Gotic in one direction and the Placa Catalunya in the other direction. Having read a lot about the pickpockets and street thieves of Barcelona, we carried our passports under our clothes, and locked our handbags with carabiners. We dressed well (not like tourists), and were careful not to stand in crowds, and as a result we did not have a negative experience or dodgy encounter the entire time we were there, even in the metro stations or the Barcelona Sants railway station. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel in a most convenient location”
Reviews.Author: sharonl39
Reviews.Content: We spent two days here prior to going on a tour and it was terrific. The manager, Sr. Lopez, could not have been more gracious and welcoming. Even though we arrived early, our room was ready and waiting for us. Beg for the 6th floor room with a balcony - you get a view of the Palau Guell no one else sees!

Reviews.Title: “We always stay here - great location & excellent hotel services.”
Reviews.Author: RambliJohn
Reviews.Content: The location is a winner, for ease of access to the Ramblas and straight over into Placa Reial. It's true that there is some traffic noise and late-night revellers but, on balance, it works well for us! We stayed on third floor this time, probably a bit higher up than on previous occasions, and it did seem somewhat quieter. Great buffet breakfast, large clean room with nice bathroom - really all very good. We'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, but beware potential noise problem”
Reviews.Author: KandM80
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a very nice stay at the Hotel Gaudi. We had originally booked to stay in April, but had to cancel the booking due to the volcanic ash problem. However the hotel kindly offered to offset the cost of our original booking against a booking made later in the year. Everything about the hotel was good value and positive . Friendly efficient staff, clean rooms, good breakfast etc. BUT be aware that Barcelona is a vibrant and bustling city, and although the location of the hotel is excellent, the area can be very noisy at night, sometimes right through to the early morning. So if you do book, and we certainly do recommend the hotel, and you want a good night's sleep, make sure that you ask for a room that does not front onto the Nou de la Rambla. Bye the way, there was no problem in moving us to a quieter room when one was available.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Awesome Staff!”
Reviews.Author: borkoborko
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews here, they are all believable! The rooms were fantastic, the staff was great and it was good value for Money. It is in the beginning end just off Las Ramblas. I unfortunately was mugged over in Barcelona but the staff at the hotel were extremely helpful with everything. The rooms are large and we had a 3 bedroom room 4th floor with a huge balcony overlooking Barcelona. The only downside is the safe had problems and there was only one computer to gain internet access and you could only use WIFI in a small room above reception. Other than that, I would stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel just off Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: MaryfromBristol
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a very spacious quad room with a terrace overlooking the city. The terrace was the icing on the cake. The room was clean the beds comfortable - we had an enormous 7 foot double, a single and a pull down bed. The bathroom was spotless with great shower. Air con was needed in August - it worked well but was noisy so we didn't keep it on all night. The hotel is situated in the Raval just off the main drag of the Ramblas and within easy walking of Barri Gothic, Barcelonetta and the beaches. We found that for 4 of us it made sense to get cabs everywhere - they are cheap in Barcelona and you get to see more than using the metro all the time. Breakfast was served until 11.30am each day (very civilised) and was self service. Ample amounts consisting of pastries, fruit, cereal, make your own toast, cold meats (chorizo, salami and what loooked like spam - not tempted by this!) plastic cheese, yoghurt and hot choice including scrambled eggs, sausages and bacon. No stinting on amount of food so we found we didn't really feel hungry until the evening. Great hotel, well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great service”
Reviews.Author: degania
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the hotel. Very nice rooms, ac worked perfectly, good breakfast. We loved the location, off Ramblas, so a "bit" less active, close to subway & attractions. Nice view of the Gaudi building across the street. Did not like paying for safe, but not too bad. Picked up free internet as well.

Reviews.Title: “This little gem gets better”
Reviews.Author: Hugechurbes
Reviews.Content: Our umpteenth visit, and we have no intention of using anywhere else in Barcelona. The staff are delightful, and keen to make you welcome. Breakfast is still buffet style, as much as you care to eat (there are some greedy people abou, not good to see so early in the day) and a good selection. The location is as central as it gets, so the noise of a busy city is ever-present, but certainly not the big-deal mentioned elsewhere. Tea and coffee after 2300 hours, even from a machine, is all that is missing. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, especially when you're stuck!”
Reviews.Author: JesGhent
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying five nights, because of flight problems due to volcanic ahs. The staff was very friendly (especially Arnau, thank you very much!!!). The rooms are clean and rather spacious. The rooms with a street view are noisier than those on the back side of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel to be stuck in during Volcanic Ash Cloud Crisis !”
Reviews.Author: ValandPixie
Reviews.Content: Hotel Gaudi is the perfect location to be in for people who have never been to Barcelona, like us. What started out as a 4 day break ended up as a 10 day extended break due to the Volcanic Ash Cloud Crisis. Hotel Gaudi is situated just off the famous Las Ramblas, which means it's less noisy at night, i am a very light sleeper and slept peacefully as the windows are double glazed. We visited lots of tourists attractions quite easily as after a short 5 minutes stroll to the Christopher Colombus Statue, all the Bus Touristics Hop on Hop off are there. They were brilliant, very convenient and stopped at all the major attractions. You can buy the Bus Touristic Packs at the hotel lobby where you will get a discount as well. There are also lots to see when you are just walking around each district, Hotel Gaudi is right in the middle of everything. There is an ATM machine just accross from the hotel just in case you need cash and lots of tiny supermarkets opened late at night next door to the hotel just in case you get the munchies. We had a spacious room on the 5th floor, with a large balcony with table and 2 chairs, facing Gaudi's Palau Guell colourful chimneys. Everything was very good in the room, large flat screen tv, powerful shower, large clothes presses, safe, air conditioning which you could set yourself. comfortable bed. The only tiny negative point i would put down is that there was no kettle or tea and coffee making facilities in the room,but we got used to it. Room was cleaned everyday and sparkled, Buffet breakfast was very good, it opened from 7.30am until 11am with a large selection of hot and cold food, perfect to set you up for a day's walking around. There is a large "living room" beside the restaurant for people to meet and natter and watch football matches on the giant screen. There is also an internet room on the 1st Floor (free) which got very busy when everyone got stranded, trying to reschedule flights, boats, trains, etc... to get back home. All staff were absolutely brilliant and very friendly, very helpful as to what to visit next, giving directions, and there was no problems conversationwise as most of them spoke english and french as well as spanish and catalan. They were a great help during our stay. I would like to thank them all, they were very nice indeed. All in all, i would go back to Hotel Gaudi again and would recommend it. We will never forget our first holiday abroad ! PS : beware of pickpockets though, they are everywhere in Barcelona. During our 10 day stay, we heard of 4 incidents. Just wear a neck pouch and hide it under your clothes like we did and you'll be fine :)

Reviews.Title: “Quick over night stay was a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: TXTravelers55
Reviews.Content: We were spending time in Valencia and decided to drive down to Barcelona for an overnight and a little sight seeing with our 18 and 15 year old sons. We booked the quad and were very pleased how spacious it was, the bathroom was roomy and the beds were comfortable. The breakfast had everything we needed to start our day and the location to the Ramblas and the train station was great. Overall would definitely stay there again. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Short Break Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BARCAMAD
Reviews.Content: Came for a few days with my family and can highly recomend the Hotel Gaudi. A perfect location just of the central part of the Ramblas moments away from plenty of restaraunts and cafes. The Metro is only a few minutes walk away which will get you anywhere you want to go quickly and cheaply and is very easy to navigate. Our rooms where immaculate and the beds very comfortable. The heating is centerally controled, but the rooms always seemed just about right.The bathrooms where modern and stylish with excellent showers. We had small balconies at the front of the hotel which looked directly at Gaudi's Palau Guell (sorry about the spelling) which is across the narrow street and was a nice bonus. Breakfast was simple, but hot and plentifull and a great start to the day. The staff were always helpfull although you are on the go so much you are hardly in the hotel so seldom actually see anyone. The only small negative about the Hotel was some noise from the street, but that was only occasional and a price worth paying for such a great location.Overall excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Ramblas...... but a bit noisy!”
Reviews.Author: RambliJohn
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here some years ago and we were pleased to find the hotel every bit as good this time. The room & en suite bathroom were of a good size, with a small balcony and view directly onto Palace Guell. Our breakfast was fine, with fair choice and self-service. The Ramblas and side street do seem to be a bit noisy, thanks to jolly late night revellers, but that is the price to pay for the superb position, just a few steps from Ramblas and opposite the Placa Real, with its excellent bars & restaurants. Certainly happy to view this as our standard stop-over place in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Beuatiful friendliest staff”
Reviews.Author: AntonN
Reviews.Content: great location just off the Ramblas, so less noise, great rooms, - all superiors & up have either a terrace or balcony, and its right across the street from Gaudis family estate home which is in the process of being transformed into a museum of sorts for Gaudi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lovely Views from the large terraces”
Reviews.Author: ELICASTLE09
Reviews.Content: We had booked a quad room for our stay with our children ages 17 and 12. Upon checking in I inquired as to getting two separate rooms since we were celebrating our wedding anniversary. Milagros at the check in desk was wonderful, she showed us the quad room that was very ample for the four of us. Then she showed us a room on the 4th floor with an amazing terrace with views of the rooftop of the Guell Museum in front that offerred Gaudi designed shapes on the roof. We decided to get our private room, our kids were on the same floor with a balcony as well. The staff bought us a bottle of Cava (Spanish Champagne) to celebrate our anniversary. Their entire Hotel Staff was courteous and welcoming. They had a decent American breakfast with a good coffee machine and fresh juices. The location is just about a block from the Ramblas where you will find great restaurants, shopping and an exciting vibe. Recommend this hotel for families with children or couples.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Spain”
Reviews.Author: div717
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near tourist street La Rambla. It a nice hotel located across Palau Guell. The staff were friendly, and helpful. The front desk people spoke english. The room was clean. However the room was small (like most hotel rooms in europe). We also have a small 13in TV. Had to pay 10 euros to have access to the safe. The hot breakfast was nice. If you want a quite room then request one in the back. La Rambla are is know for pick pocketer so be careful even when your near the hotel. Overall it a nice boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to other TripAdvisors reviews- we got what we expected.”
Reviews.Author: ladylee23
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were allocated room 414- only suitable for single occupancy so we asked to move. The Balcony on room 130 gave us the views of 'shanty town' however it was quiet! Breakfast was acceptable but should have air con. Laundry changed daily, staff helpful and friendly. Disappointed with Barcelona- seedy, not clean, VERY expensive and numerous tourist attractions not open. Would I return-NO!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ftrisholady
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Gaudi for two nights, it was perfectly placed on the Ramblas, and yet it was quiet and comfortable. The rooms were clean and had little extras provided for your comfort. The staff were freindly and helpful and were more than happy to give you all the information you needed for your stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for sightseeing, recommended for first time travellers”
Reviews.Author: SarahSteffens
Reviews.Content: Pleasant hotel facing an impressive Gaudi designed house. Thin walls, therefore can be noisy at times. View from the back of the hotel on balcony is of local residence, so expect to see washing hanging out and what the guy across the street's watching on TV. Nice basic rooms, cleaned daily and thoroughly. Nice bathroom with the option of clean towels daily, plus hairdryer. Great location by La Rambla, in the street directly opposite across the La Rambla takes you to a great square in the gothic area with bars, restaurants and clubs. Ideal location for metro and access to taxis. 5 euros from La Rambla to Port Olympic. 25/30 euros taxi from hotel to the airport (Barcelona's main airport). Breakfast choice disappointing, however nice enough for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Internet Did Not Work; Overpriced; 1970's Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jjellison
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed in this hotel and will not return. It was the only low point in our Barcelona stay, so try to find a hotel that matches this city's charm, otherwise you will regret. The Gaudi fountain in the lobby is the only nice thing, but it is clearly a gimmick to draw in tourists. Aside from the fountain, this hotel is actually very plain inside, looked like it was last renovated 40 years ago. This hotel's rooms were described in our guide book as "classic" - what a shame. By classic, they meant it looked like rooms from the 70's. My standard room was dark, depressing, and so overpriced because you are paying for location. Th Internet didn't work no matter how hard we tried to connect (in the breakfast room). The staff said one of their networks was broken, but we couldn't get on the other either. They charged a daily rate on top of the room rate for use of the room safe (apparently this is standard in Spain?). Lastly, to add insult to injury, the free breakfast was really bad - about the same kind of food you would get at a Quality Inn motel free breakfast in the US. Certainly not worthy of Barcelona. For the same location, I would try another hotel along Las Ramblas next time. The only positive thing about Hotel Gaudi is that it is near Plaza Real and the Lyceu Opera - but so are other hotels. I would stay at Hotel Husa Oriente next time - I had compared the two online, and made the wrong choice. Oriente looked much better in person and is near the same location. Don't be fooled by the Gaudi name - this hotel has nothing at all that is architecturally charming.

Reviews.Title: “Never again !”
Reviews.Author: jonandtara
Reviews.Content: Whilst its location is an advantage being close to the beach and La Rambla that was the only positive i found. The attitude of the staff was at best unfirendly and at worst downwright abusive. After havving a stand up row with the staff over a bill for breakfast we then tried to speak to the manager who is rarely on site. Eventually when we sore him he barely recognised the attitude as aproblem and gave only a semblance of an apology to my wife who had been shouted at by his staff. The whole experience was one of take it or leave it with no pride in the hotel or their manners. the best part of this hotel was when we were out of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeedsAngie123
Reviews.Content: Brilliant Hotel, Friendly staff and a lovely quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay if you can get one of the remodelled rooms facing the Gaudi building.”
Reviews.Author: GoUCLAbruins
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights. It was suggested by the Michelin Guide. Our first night was in an extremely small room with a double bed with a small window. We asked for a room facing the Gaudi Palace across the street which we were able to get the 2nd-4th night. The second room was remodelled, large, great view of the city and bathroom. Be sure to ask for a room facing the Palace on the high floors and you will get a large private balcony and great view. Breakfast was excellent and included. Great location- quiet yet a block away from the Rambla. Hotel front desk recommended good restaurants. WIFI if you have your own computer but no business center/internet access. Great A/C in remodelled room.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: scottsbabe
Reviews.Content: Best hotel cant fault it , stayed there twice , room excellent , food excellent, location excellent , staff excellent, what more can one say ... Wouldnt stay anywhere else anyone going you wont be disapointed at all.

Reviews.Title: “a great location!”
Reviews.Author: sandra49
Reviews.Content: literally yards from la rambla - we were able to walk everywhere we wanted to see. Only minutes walk to the cathedral, the Picasso museum and the marina. The Hotel was friendly and efficient and I found it clean and equipped to the extent you would expect at a 3* hotel. No problems at at all - I would certainly return there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: flossiemi
Reviews.Content: Hotel Gaudi is a lovely hotel situated just off La Rambla and a 10 minute stroll from Plaza Catalunya. All the staff were very friendly and the room was spotlessly clean. The only drawback was that it was that the noise from the street was very loud until 3am.

Reviews.Title: “Good to be back!”
Reviews.Author: Bruce-and-Carol
Reviews.Content: Our third stay at the Gaudi, a great value hotel with delightful staff. While this hotel is not 5*, nor does it claim to be, it is in a great location, just across from Palau Guell, which rightly justifies the Hotel claiming the Gaudi name! ...and it's only 50 yards to the Ramblas, and then directly opposite Placa Reial. The staff and the location were our reasons for returning, and as they knew that it was our Anniversary, we were given a room on the 6th floor with a massive terrace and a view of the Palau rooftop and chimneys (Wow!) especially good as the Palau Guell is not accessible during renovations......this was made even more special by a welcoming bottle of cava on ice. Excellent start to a great break. The panoramic view from the terrace gives you about 300 degrees coverage of the city rooftops and the hills beyond. If you want top of the range go elsewhere, but if you prefer good service with a smile at a good price, this should be your choice. Thanks again Gaudi.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Crazeecatz
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel to be close to La Rambla. Couldn't book in until 1400 hours but staff locked away our cases for us. The hotel was ideally situated just off La Rambla so just as we had expected. Had asked for high room with balcony if possible and that's exactly what we got. Had a huge terrace/balcony with direct views of Palau Guell and the ornamental chimneys opposite. Room was good, looked like it had recently been refurbished, air conditioning was very welcome as we definitely needed it as the weather was really hot. We were pleased to find that there were 3 small supermarkets really close to the hotel and also a cash till opposite. We did not find any problem with noise even though we were at the front of the hotel, though the fire alarm did go off at 0540 hours which was a bit of a shock. Breakfast was mostly continental but a few hot items as well. Staff were friendly and helpful and really polite. Only fault was that the small bar in the hotel didn't want to serve after 2300 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daisymay37
Reviews.Content: This is a good comfortable hotel at an affordable price. Rooms are a reasonable size with excellent ensuite facilities. The hotel is clean and tidy and the beds are comfortable. Staff are helpful and speak some English. The hotel is within about 2 minutes walk of La Rambas. We were originally placed in a room at the front of the hotel and the noise the first night was terrible - it was impossible to sleep. Having read reviews on Trip Advisor we realised that some rooms must be quiet so we asked to change rooms. For the rest of our holiday we were given a room at the back of the hotel. This was very quiet; we did not even hear noise from any other guests. We also had a small balcony. Breakfast is very good consiting of a buffet that includes both English and Continental. We would definately stay here again but would insist that we were given a room at the back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel doesnt warrant being called Hotel Gaudi really...”
Reviews.Author: suzifloozi44
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at this hotel for one night before going off on a Med cruise. The public rooms are quaint with some nice "Gauid" features but it doesnt really justify the name of Hotel Gauid I dont think. The room we had was miniscule although it did have a balcony at the back looking over what can only be described as the view you would least write home about. Dilapidated, falling apart old buildings, with a large police station back yard as the highlight when it came to the view. It was also absolutely bouncing down with rain for the 24 hours we were there so we made no use of the balcony. The bathroom was very nice and then room was probably quite newly done, it was just far too small. The beds were single, when we'd asked for a double bed, but there were actually like sleeping on boards, so more than one night there would have meant a trip to the chiropractor !! Reception staff were pleasant and helpful. and breakfast was very average. We did ring room service to ask for some early morning coffee and this arrived almost as soon as I'd put the phone down, delivered by a pleasant and smiling waitress. Location is also pretty good, and the advantage of being at the back, with the lousy view, was that we didnt notice any street noise. It was too expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Hell at Hotel Gaudi Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: ElaineIrelandDublin
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a trip to Hotel Gaudi earlier today and feel compelled to advise anyone travelling to Barcelona not to stay at this Hotel. I booked a stay for myself and two other family members as part of a surprise Christmas present and I have never been more disappointed in a Hotel or its Staff before. When we checked in on Wednesday 16th January we were told that the Hotel had charged us for the first night of our stay the previous day to ensure that our Visa worked, I was asked to sign payment for the first night prior to seeing the room that the Hotel had allocated to us. When I was booking the Hotel I had added in the comments box that we would like "a room with a view" if possible - little did I know what I was in for!!The porter brought us up to the 6th floor of the Hotel and into 1 of 2 rooms on this, the top floor. When we entered I was so shocked, firstly one of the beds had not been made so he proceeded to make the bed infront of us, secondly, the heater for the air conditioning wasn't working in the room so a maintenance guy from the Hotel came into the room and proceeded to flick switches on a remote control. The room was not what was shown on the Hotel's website, I know sometimes this happens but this room was like a shack - freezing cold and no hot running water!When we complained the concierge did not want to know, he was very rude and told us he didn't have any spare rooms. We asked for a plug in radiator but were told that there were none available - we ended up sleeping in several layers of clothes in the damp beds and were cold through to our bones the next morning. We went down to reception the following morning and after the porter coming to our room and flicking the switches on the air conditioning and agreeing it was broken we were moved to a brilliant room on the 2nd floor - it was warm with hot water with better beds, we arranged to meet the manager of the hotel the next day to discuss what had happened and to be compensated for the horrible and upsetting start to our holiday. When we met the Manager he told us that because we had asked for the "room with a view" that basically this is what we could expect - when we replied that there was no hot water or heat in the room he told us the only thing he could do for us would be to organise to send a basket of fruit and bottle of wine/cava to our room - we told him this wasn't good enough but he insisted this was all he could do!Later the fruit was delievered to the room but we refused it (we had seen a basket of fruit being delievered to a room the previous day & we were told by one of the members of staff that a couple had complained a few days previously and that they had been offered the fruit and wine and had been happy with this - it must be a regular occurrence!!)Basically the staff and hotel were awful and although we really enjoyed our 1st trip to Barcelona I would urge you to stay somewhere with professional and helpful staff. We ended up getting a small reduction on our bill for the 1st night - but after having paid over 200 euro for our 1st night and being mistreated as we were a pathetic 25% off didn't go anyway near making up for their inefficiency. Please take my advice and stay away from this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bustling Area”
Reviews.Author: howitisnow
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and cosy , staff very helpful , breakfast was adequate , typical of Spain , Here is the " BUT " Restoration in progress on the Gaudi building accross the narrow road , Augh !! the noise level is not good , day and night , also woken by revelers leaving pubs just further along the road from the Gaudi , around five in the morning , and police rounding up the local ladies of the night , with sirens and flashing lights in the street below , but saying all that , it is 2 mins off the Ramblas and You see Barcelona warts and all , advise to get off the Ramblas to eat out , It can be expensive and poor quality as I found out !! We did like Barcelona and will be paying another visit but will look for and hotel out off the hustle and bustle , wich is a shame as had no reason to not like the hotel its self , Just the area , but that is big cities , but not for us !!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, noisy, noisy”
Reviews.Author: Myksyk
Reviews.Content: Whoever wrote that this hotel wasn't noisy must have had the privilege of a room to the back of the hotel.
