We stayed two nights in a room overlooking Nou de la Rambla facing the Gaudi building being renovated across the street. There were noisy revellers in the streets below up until 6.30 in the morning on both nights, just an hour or so before the builders got started on their days work. The windows simply didn't do a good job of excluding noise. If you stay here ask for a room away from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Muy Bien Gaudi!”
Reviews.Author: SugarStar
Reviews.Content: We came back from a wonderful 7 night stay today and I have to say that you could not wish for a nicer hotel, staff were very helpful, friendly and spoke english, the rooms were clean and spacious, the breakfast varied from traditional continental to english cooked, in fact the only complaint we had was that the air conditioning didn't seem to keep the room cool all of the time. Very central location just off Ramblas but still quiet. opposite Palau Guell which we did not realise is currently closed for major renovation. Try the hotel food for lunch or dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: osh
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Barcelona and stayed at the Gaudi Hotel for 4 nights. the hotel is located just off the Ramblas in a street wher there is a bit of building work in progress opposite the hotel. Not an elegant street by any means and quite a lot of hostals and cheaper shops around. The hotel itself was clean, with small rooms, not bad self service breakfasts (cheaper to go to any nearby cafe) whilst Barcelona is not a cheap place to stay, I thought the Gaudi Hotel as very over priced with not a huge amount going for it. The staff were efficient, and hepfull, but I probably wouldn't stay there again given the choice. Our room was on the 1st floor to the rear of the building with views of a very close nearby building and hardly offering any privacy if you wanted to leave the curtains open for natural light. Coming back to the hotel late at night (or in the early hours of the morning) you had to be aware that the 50 metre stretch of road from the Ramblas to the hotel could be quite intimidating with beggars and drunks in abundance. I consider this a fair and unbiased report.

Reviews.Title: “Gaudi was a Genius”
Reviews.Author: CurtisTalls
Reviews.Content: Gaudi hotel is a excellent pick for someone on a budget looking to stay in a central, comfortable location. Right on BCN's famed Ramblas, The Gaudi couldnt be a better location. Barcelona is such an amazing city, full of things to see and do, and this hotel puts you right in the center of it. The hotel itself is clean and well kept. Nothing really stood out that would make me give this hotel a bad review. It's definitely of # star standards, but if you're ok with that, book it. You wont be let down.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel, Central location”
Reviews.Author: Idrone
Reviews.Content: Would have rated this hotel as average if not for location which is very good, just off ramblas. Nothing exceptional but value for money. If on a budget would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Barca great, Hotel Gaudi not so great!”
Reviews.Author: Gill_&_Paul
Reviews.Content: Great location. Staff pleasant enough. Clean. Had a back room, (advised less noisy), so no view. The room was quite small for a 3 star, but amenities as expected for rating. Breakfast not brilliant for 10 euros plus tax. Here was the big problem; we have never stayed in a hotel that was this noisy, and I'm not referring to street noise. People in the adjacent rooms sounded like they were in our bathroom, the flushing of others' toilets seemed inordinately loud, just the scrape of a chair in the room above was like nails scraping down a blackboard. Listening to other people lovemaking is quite funny the first time, but is a pain when you are trying to sleep. There seemed to be some sort of work going on at early hours of the morning - lots of banging. You may think that I'm exaggerating, but noise doesn't normally bother me as I play drums in a rock band and am half deaf! I would rate the hotel as a high 2 star and would only stay again if there was nothing better. Barca hints:- Don't eat or drink on Las Ramblas. Have a look in the other areas and you'll find it less expensive, less packed and less 'touristy'. The Venus (25 Carrer Avinyo, gothic quarter) is an excellent Catalan style restaurant and very reasonably priced. Watch your bags/personal possessions; nearly every party we spoke to had experienced thieves/pickpockets. Barca was a fantastic city break and will definitely return, there is so much to see and do and it has a great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely on my will visit again list”
Reviews.Author: holidays_r_important
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for somewhere to stay in Barcelona then this is somewhere I'd definitely recommend!!!!!!!!!!! The service was brilliant ... the staff fantastic ... and everywhere was spotlessly clean. AND ... as if the hotel wasn't good enough ... the location was fantastic. It is situated just off the middle of the Ramblas ... which means its quiet enough, but also only less than a minute away from the heart of Barcelona. We got a train direct from the airport and then a metro into the city ... and the hotal was only 3 minutes walk from the metro station. The metro in Barcelona is the best way to get around ... very reasonably priced and feels very safe (unlike some cities I have visited). There's a great cafe / restaurant only a couple of hundred yards away if you don't want to eat in the hotel ............ but I would DEFINITELY recommend the buffet breakfast in the hotel as everything is freshly prepared and theres loads of fresh fruits. All in all this was one of the best hotels I hace stayed in and definitely a good find!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: Simontru
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Gaudi with my nine year old daughter for a three night stay. The hotel itself is set just 20 yards off La Rambla (main pedestrian artery through Barca), about 2/3rds down towards the port end. This location is ideal for siteseeing and the atmosphere of La Rambla! I found the Hote to be modern, very clean ant the staff very helpful (esp Alex on reception). I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: happyclappy234
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Gaudi is in a great location, staff on reception very helpful. Bedroom was alright but basic. Bathroom not great. Breakfast not very exciting but was adequate. But the location made up for this as we were only a couple of minutes from the Ramblas. A word of warning though watch out for pick pockets on the ramblas and in the fruit market. Also the taxi drivers as ours tried to charge us 50 euros but lucky enough the hotel porter heard what the taxi driver said and told us to only pay him 30 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly Hotel Gaudi”
Reviews.Author: Gis001
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a lovely 2 day holiday in Barcelona, and 2 days in Lloret de Mar. Hotel Gaudi in Barcelona is ideally located in the city centre, corner with La Ramblas and within walking distance to marina and main city square. The Hotel Gaudi offers comfortable and clean accommodation however rooms are small and can be uncomfortable for longer stays. There is no Manager available to deal with guests and we had an unpleasant experience with one rude and agressive Receptionist that totally refused to help us and arrange special transportation for us to go to Lloret de Mar. You need a good 5 days to appreciate this beautiful City, however most people speak only Spanish and communication is not easy and most people are reluctant to help. A good travel guide comes handy. The restaurants are of high standard but be prepared to pay. We recommend Hotel Gaudi for its location, however it lacks professional and reliable customer care. The Staff at Hotel Oasis Park in Lloret, on the otherhand, were all welcoming, friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: thjX
Reviews.Content: Had a double room for 3 nights. Room spotless and comfortable. Had everything you might need apart from tea/coffee making facilities. Room had recently been refurbished. Plumbing a bit noisy. Workmen still working on the same floor as us but as we were out all day so did not interfere with what we were doing. Stayed Friday to Monday so perhaps noise would be worse if we stayed during the week. Booked direct with hotel at Euro 110 per night - definitely better value than a package. Bought very expensive snack at local tapas bar first day but after that found excellent value at Attic restaurant towards top of La Ramblas near to Placa Catalunya - lovely 3 course meal for two with wine under £40.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was above average, the room comfortable, the facilities modern and in good condition. Had a double room on the front of the hotel, overlooking Grand Via. The street noise was quite noticable in spite of two sets of windows. The breakfast restaurant was very good and the service above average. Would consider staying there again but would insist on a room away from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: surfer_Fin
Reviews.Content: WE stayed here for a weekend and had a very enjoyable time. I had contacted the hotel before our stayed and asked for a view of the Palace. Even though the Palau was closed, it was still lovely to have our own terrace. The staff were very friendly and accomodating and the hotel was very central. We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel Gaudi and would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “very basic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: definitely not worth the money i paid for it! i booked a package with thomas cook id definitely recommend making your own package as i paid well over the odds. The hotel staff were friendly, however the room was very small and basic with someone elses hairs on the toilet when we arrived, this definitely put me right off! the breakfast is what you expect to recieve. hotel overall-very basic worthy of two stars in my opinion as it is definitely the worst three star hotel ive stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: airportblues
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a short stay in the hotel Gaudi, this is the second time we have been to Barcelona in the last few years but the first time we have used this hotel, we will go back again if we get the chance. If you want to be in the middle of Barcelona, try the hotel Gaudi as it’s in an excellent location just a few seconds walk from the Ramblas. The room we had was clean and the bathroom spotless. Very friendly staff and an excellent breakfast will keep you exploring Barcelona all day and boy is there plenty to look at. A word of caution if you are going to get a taxi from the airport, we got done over by an elderly bandit who was also working as an official taxi driver, he charged us nearly twice the going rate of 25 euros for the trip. The nice man in the hotel explained how much it was going to cost when we returned to the airport and said if we got caught again that we could email him with the drivers number and he would report him, made us feel a bit better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: clairetulula
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Nice clean, spacious rooms and staff were friendly enough. The location was fantastic. Just off Las Ramblas and very near to many of Barcelona's attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: herfds
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel in an excellent location, 30 seconds walk from La Rambla and therefore right in the heart of the street-life both day and night! The room we had was clean and with plenty of space and storage. We were on the 4th floor and had a wonderful view of the Palau the other side of the road. We also had a sun terrace with sunbeds, the weather was so warm we tested them out! Although the street noises were loud one night, they were no more that could be expected in any large and lively city. Breakfast was buffet style and more than adequate with hot and cold foods as well as cereals and a make-it-yourself toast machine. Service was friendly and polite and all staff spoke English. Staff in reception were particularly helpful. Room service is available, the hotel does have a small bar which closes at 11p.m. but you will find plenty of shops and restaurants very close by.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect position”
Reviews.Author: DWK14
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Gaudi is in a perfect position for sightseeing in Barcelona. Just off Las Ramblas 5 mins walk from the harbour, 15 mins to the beach, close to the metro and most of the 'must do' tourist spots within easy walking distance. Our room was spotlessly clean, with excellent bathroom facilities. The staff were friendly and we really appreciated the bottle of Cava left in our room by the management when they found out it was our 25th wedding anniversary. Barcelona is a wonderful city and the Hotel Gaudi is a great place to base yourself for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, great breakfast!!!”
Reviews.Author: litchy
Reviews.Content: My girl friends and I went for a short break to Barcelona to take in the sightes. I booked the hotel over the net so I wasn't quite sure that it would be ok? We were pleasently surprised, we were booked in quickly with a smile, our luggage was taken straight to our room. Also the receptionist gave us discount vouchers for meals in the city. We had booked a quad room and had asked for the room to be high with a view. Sadly the room wasn't with a front view we were at the rear. But having said that the room was very large, very clean and the beds were nicely made up. We had a balcony that over looked the police station and the roof tops of Barcelona. I have booked to go back to Barcelona but at another hotel. Not because we didn't like this one, but because I found a better standard hotel at at a better price, just off the Ramblas. But I would have no hessitation in going back to this hotel again if the was the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “great location..give it a try”
Reviews.Author: Crewy
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Barcelona, so we wanted somewhere close to the attractions. The hotel, although in a back street, certainly was close to the attractions..about 50 metres from La Rambla, but far enough away not to hear the late night goings on. Started off in a quad room on floor 6, with our own terrace overlooking the city, but half way through our 5 night stay we had to be moved to a 3rd floor room, due to our air con possibly flooding other rooms (our air con ran 24/7.. it was hot!) Harbour pleasant, La Rambla vibrant (watch out for pick pockets and ball/cup scams), must eat in the Hard rock cafe, cable cars scary (very high), boat trip along the coast a bit dull, must see Sagrada Familia..althogh it's a building site, Parc Gaudi wonderful, the beach is a good 30 minute walk from La Rambla. All of the main attractions can be done in 4-5 days. Book via e-mail directly with the hotel, not through an agent..cheaper

Reviews.Title: “Back a second time”
Reviews.Author: TonyCoventry
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hotel Gaudi twice, Recomended by a colleague who had also stayed there twice, well you dont go back a second time if things arn't right do you.. The hotel is superbly situated just 50 yards from the Ramblas, close to many bars and restaurants. Rooms arn't that spacious but you only sleep in them so I dont see that as a big negative point. The breakfast buffet will keep you going all day, and the staff are friendly and helpful. Take note that the Palau Guel opposite the Hotel is currently being refurbished, and not due to re open until November /December 2006.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location - hotel just ok !!”
Reviews.Author: cunningm
Reviews.Content: Stayed the weekend here for the grand prix. As already stated - fantastic location just off Las Ramblas on a quiet narrow street. Located at the harbour end of Las Ramblas. 5 min walk to underground. Typical 2 and a half star hotel. Rooms very basic, some with large balconies. Breakfast buffet not bad - did the trick. Coffee machine etc. Cost was about €80 per person sharing for b & b per night. Mixed help from reception - some very helpful, some not !! Would recommend for location not for luxury !!!
